comment: This is a page from a classical Chinese dictionary or lexicographical text, likely the *Shuowen Jiezi* or a similar work. The layout includes large characters (likely seal script) on the left, followed by explanations in regular script. The content discusses etymology, pronunciation (via *fanqie*), and meanings of characters related to bamboo (*竹*) and its derivatives. The text mentions '文五 新附' (Five new appended characters), indicating this section contains newly added entries. The characters discussed include 筿, 篁, 箕, etc., with detailed analysis of their forms, components, and usage.
